text: Nérac (; ) is a commune in the Lot-et-Garonne department in south-western France. The composer and organist Louis Raffy was born in Nérac, as well as the former Arsenal and Bordeaux footballer Marouane Chamakh. Nérac was visited by author Joanne Harris as a child, and was influential in the setting of her best-known novel, Chocolat.. ==See also== *Communes of the Lot-et-Garonne department ==References== ==External links== *Town council website Category:Communes of Lot-et-Garonne Category:Subprefectures in France Category:Lot-et-Garonne communes articles needing translation from French Wikipedia
title: Nérac
